venue.name: The Thompson Room 110, Barker Center, Harvard University

item.description:
The Harvard Food Literacy Project is presenting  Kings of Pastry as part of its summer lunchtime film series. It is free and open to the public.

Here's what the Harvard Food Literacy Project had to say about Kings of Pastry via e-mail:

*****Imagine a scene never before witnessed: Sixteen French pastry chefs gathered in Lyon for three intense days of mixing, piping, and sculpting everything from delicate chocolates to 6-foot sugar sculptures in hopes of being declared by President Nicolas Sarkozy one of the best. This is the prestigious Meilleurs Ouvriers de France (Best Craftspeople in France) competiton. The blue, white, and red striped collar worn on the jackets of the winners is more than the ultimate recognition for every pastry chef -- it is a dream and an obsession. (84 mins.) (This event is a collaboration with POV, the award-winning independent nonfiction film series on PBS  http://www.pbs.org/pov)

All films will be screened on Fridays at lunchtime (12 noon to 1 p.m. approximately). Bring your lunch. French-themed snacks will be provided.*****

You can bring your lunch to this movie. Or you can hope (like I am) that "French-themed snacks" means gourmet chocolate cupcakes! The movie is almost one and a half hours long.

I will arrive at the Barker Center early; my plan is to arrive between 11:30 and 11:45 a.m. I'll try to find a seat near the back of the room so that it will be easier to look for me. I'll be carrying my bright red backpack.

Look for me after the movie. I'll try to gather everyone, and then we can decide if we would like to go out for some kind of treat in Harvard Square.

See you at the Barker Center!

Marianne
item.how_to_find_us: Look for my bright red backpack. See the event description for more details.
